mods.abstract: Jacob McGavock Dickinson, commander of the Second Brigade (Middle Tennessee) of the Tennesseee State Guard. The Brigadier General is wearing his military uniform with the Tennessee State Guard insignia shoulder patch prominently displayed. The design for the patch was inspired by the Tennessee state flag. The three-inch in diameter patch had white stars in a dark blue center circle and a red outer ring with the white lettering of "Tennessee State Guard."

The Tennessee State Guard was formed in 1941 to serve as the state's volunteer military force after the Tennessee National Guard had been federalized for service in World War II. Franklin's renowned Arabian horse breeder, Jacob McGavock Dickinson, had a noted military career in World War I. Commander-in-Chief Govenor Prentice Cooper called upon Dickinson to first command the Second Regiment (Middle Tennessee) as a colonel, then the Second Brigade as one of the three brigadier generals in the state
